author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Hear now of Blinken, stern and bold,
From Western lands, decisions told,
In Niger, coups with steel unfold,
The aiding hand may soon withhold.

Upon the Eastern isles of dawn,
A shift in fiscal plans is drawn, 
The Bank of Japan, in light reborn, 
Tolerates yields on bonds, new norms. 

Biogen, with intent aflame,
By Odin's might, stakes mighty claim,
Reata's need, for gold exchanged,
In health's name, a fortune gained.

feedItems.title: Blinken Says U.S. Aid to Niger in Jeopardy Following Coup
feedItems.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said American assistance to Niger is in jeopardy following a military coup.

feedItems.title: The Bank of Japan made an important change to its monetary policy, signaling that it would tolerate higher yields on longer-term Japanese government bonds.
feedItems.description: The Bank of Japan made an important change to its monetary policy, signaling that it would tolerate higher yields on longer-term Japanese government bonds.

feedItems.title: Biogen will pay $7.3 billion to acquire Reata Pharmaceuticals, the owner of a rare-disease treatment with the potential to be a blockbuster.
feedItems.description: Biogen will pay $7.3 billion to acquire Reata Pharmaceuticals, the owner of a rare-disease treatment with the potential to be a blockbuster.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Niger's heart, a coup doth unfold,
Guard chief to president, allegiance behold.
A junta forms, hopes of peace extinguished,
A key U.S. ally, from his post relinquished.

Gold of Exxon and Chevron's might,
In the second quarter saw a blight.
Fourteen billion, their treasure chests glean,
Less than yesteryear, yet unseen.

In New Jersey, the gavel fell hard,
Johnson & Johnson's plea, the judge barred. 
Their talc liability, a weight to bear,
In the court of law, an affair declared.

feedItems.title: The head of Niger's presidential guard declared himself the leader of a new junta after deposing a president who was a key U.S. ally in the fight against extremism.
feedItems.description: The head of Niger’s presidential guard declared himself the leader of a new junta after deposing a president who was a key U.S. ally in the fight against extremism.

feedItems.title: Exxon and Chevron collectively banked nearly $14 billion in second-quarter profits, down from last year's record-breaking levels but adding to their war chests.
feedItems.description: Exxon and Chevron collectively banked nearly $14 billion in second-quarter profits, down from last year’s record-breaking levels but adding to their war chests.

feedItems.title: A bankruptcy judge in New Jersey threw out the second chapter 11 case that Johnson & Johnson filed to resolve its mass talc liabilities.
feedItems.description: A bankruptcy judge in New Jersey threw out the second chapter 11 case that Johnson & Johnson filed to resolve its mass talc liabilities.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Fed's hawkish goal as inflation retreats,
Like hares from a snarl, money discreetly cheats.
Beneath economy's spindle, figures twirl,
As price pressures unwind, and quietly unfurl.

New rules for fuel, proposed with a hound's might,
Seek to trim the wasteful, candle-lit night.
Sure as the goat steadfast on mountain crest,
Savings and cleaner airs are considered best.

Goldman's once sturdy mast, begins its fall,
Pillars of Solomon erode as they sprawl.
Executives flee, like rabbits scared and spry,
Threatening the giant firm's strategy, oh my!

feedItems.title: Pay and price pressures showed fresh signs of retreating from the economy, adding to evidence that inflation is moving closer to the Federal Reserve's goal.
feedItems.description: Pay and price pressures showed fresh signs of retreating from the economy, adding to evidence that inflation is moving closer to the Federal Reserve’s goal.

feedItems.title: Federal regulators are proposing stricter fuel-economy standards for light-duty cars and trucks, saying the rules would save consumers money and reduce pollution.
feedItems.description: Federal regulators are proposing stricter fuel-economy standards for light-duty cars and trucks, saying the rules would save consumers money and reduce pollution.

feedItems.title: An exodus of executives from Goldman Sachs's asset-management division threatens to undermine a central pillar of CEO David Solomon's strategy for the Wall Street giant.
feedItems.description: An exodus of executives from Goldman Sachs’s asset-management division threatens to undermine a central pillar of CEO David Solomon’s strategy for the Wall Street giant.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
The stocks in U.S., like goodly wine, did flow,
Of Dow and Nasdaq, S&P in tow,
Each index rose, a stout and hearty gain,
As Friday's news in tavern's cheer contain!

'Twas then Sir Facebook, wielding mighty axe,
Did smite posts that the truth of plague relax.
At Biden’s urgence, claims of man-made bane,
In silence drowned, like ale in drunkard's drain.

And tsar Putin, his kindness to unfurl,
Did pledge his grain to feed the hungry world.
Though Ukraine's safeguard did surely come to wane,
He vows security, like monks vow abstain.

feedItems.title: U.S. stocks rebounded Friday, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow rising 1%, 1.9%, and 0.5%, respectively. All three major indexes ended with weekly gains.
feedItems.description: U.S. stocks rebounded Friday, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow rising 1%, 1.9%, and 0.5%, respectively. All three major indexes ended with weekly gains.

feedItems.title: Facebook removed content related to Covid-19 in response to pressure from the Biden administration, including posts claiming the virus was man-made, according to internal company communications viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
feedItems.description: Facebook removed content related to Covid-19 in response to pressure from the Biden administration, including posts claiming the virus was man-made, according to internal company communications viewed by The Wall Street Journal.

feedItems.title: Putin pledged to ship food and provide more security assistance to a swath of African nations after his move to end a deal safeguarding the export of Ukrainian grain.
feedItems.description: Putin pledged to ship food and provide more security assistance to a swath of African nations after his move to end a deal safeguarding the export of Ukrainian grain.
